medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe insulin-like growth factor-I (IGF-I) deficiency secondary to a homozygous partial deletion of the IGF-I gene, resulting in growth failure, mental retardation, microcephaly, and sensorineural deafness.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with severe pre- and postnatal growth failure. IGF-I therapy was initiated at age 16.07 years after showing severe symptoms, with height velocity increasing from 3.8 cm/year pretreatment to 7.3 cm/year on a higher dose of rhIGF-I.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Homozygous partial deletion of the IGF-I gene, elevated growth hormone levels, severe insulin resistance.
medical_history.family_history: Parents were consanguineous and heterozygous for the deletion.
